comments.author: Daisy Yang

comments.text:
I might be unique in my view that Bea's whole mission in these movies is 
inherently flawed. Why is she going around killing all these people? 
Theoretically, it's cause Bill killed her fiancee and unborn child. 
However, it doesn't seem as if she loved her fiancee too much, except as a 
means of establishing a normal life for herself, and the child itself 
didn't die (even though that wasn't revealed till later, of course). So 
really, what's she doing it all for? Sort of seems like she's naturally 
violent and the mere idea that these people once tried to kill her offends 
her on a professional level. ﻿
comments.author: hullothereyall

comments.author: slvrcobra1337

comments.text:
It's not really a katana itself, but rather the mounting (the handle and 
scabbard) itself is called "shirasaya." There can be many different weapons 
with a "shirasaya" mounting, and in this case the katana is in a shirasaya 
mounting.
comments.author: Johnathan Mumford

comments.text:
Wait...that shit actually exists?! I thought Tarantino just made it up to 
make her look badass. How many people have lost digits to that thing?
comments.author: slvrcobra1337

comments.text:
It's a shirasaya katana and those who wield one are either extremely 
reckless or are talented enough to make up for the fact that there is no 
guard. It does sacrifice performance for appearance but really I don't 
think that O-Ren had to worry about not performing well until she had 
fought Beatrice.
